fields.description:
Required field messages (e.g. summary: You must specify a summary of the issue.) are not displayed when a non logged user tries to create an issue using the Create Issue frame
!CreateIssueFrame.png|thumbnail!

Message is displayed correctly when creating on a separate window/tab.
!CreateIssueTab.png|thumbnail!

Issue is not created, correctly.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Set your JIRA instance to allow issue creation for non-logged users
# Click on the Create Issue button and try to create an issue without filling any fields

*Expected Results:*
JIRA should display messages specifying the required fields

*Actual Results:*
 The Create Issue frame refreshes without any errors and does not create the issue
fields.summary: Required fields message not displayed when creating issue not logged into JIRA

  {panel}

h3. Summary of Bug

When using the Wiki Style Renderer, there are times when the spacing between the bullets are not shown correctly. 

h3. Steps to replicate

# In the comment or description of an issue, enter the following (as an example) :
{noformat}
* *test*
** one
** two
* *test two*
** one
** two
{noformat}
# The preview of it would show the following :
!preview.png|thumbnail!
# However, when inserted into JIRA, the result would be the following :
!result.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Info

* Everything seems to show fine if there is an empty space placed in between the two main points, like the following :
{noformat}
* *test*
** one
** two

* *test two*
** one
** two
{noformat}

* Behavior is also different if the main points (test and test two) is not *bold* - Here is the preview :
!without bold preview.png|thumbnail!
and here is the result :
!without bold result.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Wiki Style Renderer does not show bullets spacing correctly

fields.description:
Crowd SSO requires that the *seraph-config.xml* be modified.  Once SSO is enabled, you will only be able to authenticate as users from the Crowd server defined in the crowd.properties file.

The LDAP test doesn't take this into consideration, which can be confusing for admins setting up LDAP integration.  The LDAP test will succeed, but there in reality, authentication will fail due to the SSO configuration.

See screenshots.
fields.summary: LDAP test does not consider Crowd SSO modifications

fields.description:
Currently it's possible to click on form submissions multiple times and have JIRA post duplicate data in the database.

For example, if a user clicks on Log Work multiple times ( probably due to the server responding slowly ) JIRA will enter duplicate entries.

See attached screenshot.

Probably the only thing we can do to prevent this is using JavaScript to hide the Post button after the user clicks it
fields.summary: Prevent duplicate form actions from happening - regression

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33378].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behavior:
If a field is set to 'Required' in the *Field Configuration*, it will always be prompted in any screen in any issue that uses this Field Configuration and does not have any value for the field. Even if the field is not set in any screen in JIRA.

h3. Desired Behavior:
JIRA cleans up these configurations. If a field is not present in any screens, JIRA will automatically make the field optional. 

h3. Alternative Behavior:
JIRA will disregard the 'Required' setting of the *Field Configuration* if the field is not present on the screen. This way, even though the field is required for the screens it is in, JIRA will not prompt a value for the field when it is not possible to add one. This would also help in some cases of JRA-5783, where users would only add the field to one screen.
fields.summary: Better Behavior for Required Fields
Workflow Plugin Summary View

fields.description:
Chrome [seems to have some issues|http://productforums.google.com/forum/#!topic/chrome/zID6uQQfKH8] where certain assets which are cached have their mime type clobbered and set to text/plain when retrieved (304 response). This seems to have started rearing its head in March and we are having [all kinds of issues with Tempo|https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/JTMPO-815]. The Tempo folks think this should be brought to Atlassian's attention, I imagine because it is affected by which Headers ({{X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff}}) are set on certain requests.

The end result is certain assets are retrieved from Chrome's cache with the wrong mime type which then causes Chrome's JS engine to barf or the CSS to not be parsed. (See the Tempo issue I reference above for screen caps and the errors the Javascript engine throws.)
fields.summary: Chrome caching issue causes CSS and JavaScript assets to not load

fields.description:
h3. The problem:
The [search issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Searching+for+Issues] functionality has performance issues when sorting by a [custom field type Labels|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+a+Custom+Field#AddingaCustomField-CustomFieldTypes]. 

Despite this field [appears in the index|^customfield.png], it takes much longer to return the result than sorting by other columns. This appears in {{atlassian-jira.log}} when [profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+and+Profiling] is enabled:
{code}
2013-06-03 12:53:23,276 QuartzWorker-1 DEBUG ServiceRunner    com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.bamboo.service.PlanStatusUpdateServiceImpl:job [jira.web.filters.ThreadLocalQueryProfiler]

In some situation, it times out:
{code}
2013-06-03 15:20:04,617 http-bio-8090-exec-4 ERROR admin 905x3431x5 tm9sjh 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable/ [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33357].
  {panel}

_Steps to Reproduce_

* Create an issue {{TESTONE-1}} and include the comment "foo" inside the issue for the first comment:
!bug_1.JPG|thumbnail!

* Navigating to the *Advanced Search*, using the following parameter should not display the issue {{TESTONE-1}}:
{code}
comment !~ "foo"
{code}
!bug_2.JPG|thumbnail!

* However, navigating back to the issue page, try to add the second comment "bar" into the issue:
!bug_3.JPG|thumbnail!

* This issue is reproducible using the same parameter in the *Advanced Search* JQL whereby you can see that {{TESTONE-1}} is displayed, ignoring the original condition of the JQL:
!bug_4.JPG|thumbnail!

*Workaround*

* Create a filter such as {code}comment~foo{code}, which will return all the foo comments. Save it as {{foo comments}}
* Create a new filter as {code}filter!= "foo comments"{code}. This will exclude all issues from the previous filter and the desired results will be returned.
fields.summary: JQL parameter "!~" not working properly for comment field

fields.description:
When creating an issue and intentionally leave a required field empty, it will throw a 400 Bad Request. 

Steps to replicate:
# Go to the Field Configuration Scheme for any project, and select any field to be required (For this example, let's configure the Fix Version as required)
# Enable the browser developer tool
# Create an Issue but leave the Fix Version Empty
# Reviewing the network Activities on the developer tool, it will throw a 400 bad request
!badrequest.png!

This does not occur on JIRA 4.4.5

h4. How this will effect if JIRA is integrated with IIS
This looks harmless to JIRA, but if JIRA is integrated with IIS, the required field exception is not displayed.  The workaround for can be found on the following KB article
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=364052669
fields.summary: 400 Bad Request Exception When Creating or Editing an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Incoming Emails might be rejected by the Jira Mail Handler for any of the following reasons:
- none of the recipient email address from the incoming email matched the *catch email address* configuration in the mail handler
- the incoming email is an auto-generated email and is detected as a "bulk email" by the mail handler

In such cases, the mail handler keeps the incoming mail as "UNREAD" instead of marking is as "READ" in the mailbox. As a result, whenever the mail handler scans the mailbox, it will keep processing these emails over and over, resulting in the following consequences:
- the Jira incoming Mail logs will get flooded with WARN/INFO logs saying "The message has been rejected:"
- if the mailbox contains a huge amount of those emails, the mail handler will run very slowly (as it needs to scan over and over these same emails), consumes the caesium threads and prevent other services (such as the notification mail queue service) to run on schedule

Here are 2 possible scenarios where this issue can occur:

h3. Scenario 1

When you specify an email address in the *Catch Email Address* field of an *Incoming Mail Handler*, and an email message's recipent(s) does not match the *Catch Email Address* field, the following message is logged:
{noformat}
2013-05-28 06:44:48,156 INFO [POP Mail for TKN] QuartzWorker-1 ServiceRunner    
Create Issue / Comment for Project TKN The message has been rejected: The messages recipient(s) does not match catch mail list.
{noformat}

h3. Scenario 2

When an auto-generated email is sent to the Jira Mail Handler, the mail handler will keep pulling and processing that same email over and over again, the following will be seen in the logs:
{code}
2020-12-03 14:34:17,469+0100 DEBUG [GMAIL SERVER] Caesium-1-1 anonymous    Mail handler for SCRUMP project - GMAIL Mail handler for SCRUMP project - GMAIL[10400]: The message has been rejected (Rejecting message due to failed bulk check.): From :[Julien Rey <test@test.com>], Subject: I'm out of the office Re: Test, Date: 
{code}

h3. Suggestion

The Jira mail handler should either mark such emails as "READ" (with IMAP), or delete them (with POP), so that such emails stop being processed.


h3. Workaround

h4. Scenario where the email was rejected due to the "Catch email" setting

The only way to stop the Jira Mail handler to keep processing such emails over and over is to delete them from the Mailbox the mail handler is pulling emails from, or to mark them as READ.

(!) Please note that such emails might still be stuck in the Jira mail handler data cache, so if the mail handler is still processing them:
- you can either perform a Jira re-start in order to clear the data cache
- or delete the mail handler from *⚙ > System > Incoming Mail*, and re-create it

h4. Scenario where the email was rejected due to the bulk detection

You can either follow the same workaround above (in case of catch email address detection). Or, for a long term fix, change the mail handler configuration by setting the *Bulk* field to *Delete the email permanently*
fields.summary: Mail Handler should better handle messages that are rejected due to recipient not matching catch mail list or bulk detection

fields.description:
When attempting to search for a line of text with Umlaut characters, like this:
{noformat}
Länderübergreifende
{noformat}
And the *Indexing Language* (Administration > General Configuration) is set to *German*, wildcard searches will fail to show the correct results. 

Steps to reproduce:
# Install a fresh new JIRA 6 instance.
# Change the Indexing Language to German. Run a re-index.
# Create a Project, and create an issue with Summary: "Länderübergreifende". Create another Issue with Summary:  "Länderübergreifende2"
# Search for this issue using the following JQL:
{noformat}
summary ~ "Lä*"
text ~ "Lä*"
{noformat}
The results will show "Länderübergreifende2", but *NOT*  "Länderübergreifende". However, search with
{noformat}
summary ~ "Länderübergreifende"
{noformat}
works without problems.

Now, *change the indexing language* to English/French/Other. (I have only tested 3) *Re-index* after you have changed the language. Run the same JQL queries as in step 4. The two issues will show up in the search results as expected.

Note that this does not happen if you search without Umlaut characters in your search query. For example, 
# Indexing Language: German
# Search: "L*" will show both of the issues as expected.
fields.summary: Wildcard search does not work when searched text contains Umlaut character, and indexing language is set to German

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33342].
  {panel}

h3. Justification of this Improvement Request
Customer mentions that the performance of his JIRA is currently very slow, whereby his users mention to him that whenever they login it would need to load up all the dashboard in their desired state in a very long time.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# login
# Open any project 
!1.jpg!
# select the Issues tab row (not to confuse with the Issues button at the top)
!2.jpg!
# Then it would show the project overview with Issue statistics data
# Select a different project (from the recent projects list)
# Now it would show the issue statistics page of another project
# Log out from the current user
# Log in
# Select projects button (to open the last selected project)
*Current behavior*: It would show the *Summary tab* in the project overview page
*Requested behavior*: It should show the default state, the previously selected Issues tab which is the *issue statistic data* page.
fields.summary: default state in project overview

fields.description:
We had JIRA upgraded from 5.1 to 6.0.  The worklog detail was displayed with user full name, but after upgrade to 6.0, worklog of some users are displayed with user name instead of user full name while others are still displayed in user full name. And even for those users whose worklog before upgrade are displayed in user name, their new worklog after upgrade in 6.0 is displayed with user full name. 

It causes the worklog record in Tempo plugin to be displayed separately with user name and user full name as two lines. and it bring difficulty to do statistics.

A sample as below:
* First worklog is displayed with user name
* Second worklog is displayed with user full name

!c.jpg!
fields.summary: Some worklog display in user name instead of full name after JIRA upgraded from 5.1 to 6.0

_Steps to Reproduce_
* Create a custom field (Eg. Severity) and make sure that it is applied *ONLY* to *Bug* issue type
* Create a few issues with the *Bug* issue type
* Add the column in the *Issue Navigator* and confirm that it appears on the search for Issue Type *Bug*
!issue_navigator_1.JPG|thumbnail!
!issue_navigator_2.JPG|thumbnail!

* However, searching for *All* Issue Types does not render the *Severity* column:
!issue_navigator_3.JPG|thumbnail!

* Exporting the view to Excel can be deceiving as the value of the custom field is lost comparing the following screenshot(s)
** _All Issue Type_
!excel_1.JPG|thumbnail!
** _Bug Issue Type_
!excel_2.JPG|thumbnail!

Maybe there can be some sort of improvement to this? At least to give the user to *fully* export the view to include all the fields regardless of the Issue Type or if there are any other approach to this?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33318].
  {panel}

I've been thinking about this one for a while and I think it would be a good one.

I know you can create your own workflow with your own status in Jira, however, I bet everyone is always interested in knowing what tasks are blocked or impeded by an obstacle... specially one group in particular, care to guess?, yes: Management

Management (under the Theory Z at least http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theory_Z) should always help developers/employees with obstacles, which can be things such as: awaiting customer/user response, fuzzy requirements, etc.

Having this in the default Jira workflow would improve the user experience and make Jira more useful. 

Rally is an issue tracking system that has a blocked state built in, and users do take advantage of it.
fields.summary: Add a blocked/impeded status to the default Jira workflow

fields.description:
Issue was first reported by one of our users; able to log in with Firefox, but cannot navigate to an issue, either by searching, clicking on a link, or any other method.  The ID appears in the URL and in the title of the tab, but whatever is initially on the page (have tried it from the dashboard, and from a blank tab) never changes, and the "loading..." icon next to the title of the tab never resolves. IE8 is working fine, so it's browser-specific.  Updated FF, and that did not affect the behavior.  Ran an integrity check on JIRA and there were no issues.

If you need any logs or other diagnostics, please let me know what you need.
fields.summary: Issues not loading in FireFox
Provide an "Undo" feature for when a user transitions an issue by mistake
Add admin feature to change Status field to any or previous value

Cloned Epic is not bringing the Issues in Epic

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a Custom Field named 'Progress';
# Add the field to a Screen;
# Edit an issue and fill the 'Progress' field;
# Go to the Issue Navigator and add the criteria for 'Progress';
# Fill the form and hit Search.

h4. Expected Results:
JIRA would return the issue matching the 'Progress' criteria.

h4. Actual Results:
JIRA displays an error when trying to search:
|!Basic-Search.png!|

When switching to Advanced Search, the same error is displayed:
|!Advanced-Search.png!|

h4. Notes:
When making the search directly through the *Advanced Search* and using the Auto-Complete, JIRA replaces the name of the field (Progress) with cf\[id]:
|!Advanced-Search-Autocomplete.png!|

h4. Workaround
Change the name of the Custom Field to something (slightly) different from 'Progress'.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator does not allow searches based on a Custom Field named 'Progress'

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create 2 projects in fresh JIRA instance (eg. project test and project B).
# Create an issues in both projects (eg. test-123, pb-1).
# Now create a new filter like this:{noformat}key in (TEST-123, PB-1){noformat}
# Remove the user *'Browser Project'* permission of project test.
# After that, go back to the same filter. An error shown that the key for TEST-123 is invalid and change to issue key *11305*. Please see attached:
!change_to_issue_id.JPG|thumbnail!

*Finding:*
* This problem only happen in JIRA 5.2.x.
* Also, tested in JIRA 6 but not able to reproduce it.
fields.summary: Issue key change to Issue ID after an error message occured in JQL

fields.description:
When using Advance Searching, searching for a string that had hyphen in between return result. Expected no result is returned since it is not a complete string (whole word)

Quote from the [documentation for text searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches]:

{quote}
Whole words only

JIRA cannot search for issues containing parts of words but on whole words only. The exception to this are words which are stemmed.

This limitation can also be overcome using fuzzy searches.
{quote}

Steps to replicate:
# Create an issue test-test on summary
# Search for "summary ~ test" returned the result test-test created earlier (Not expected)
# Create another issue test-test123 on summary
# Search for "summary ~ test123" returned no result (Expected)
fields.summary: Advance Search for String that Contain Hyphen Returns Result
ChangeLogUtils.createChangeGroup deprecated API alternative relies on deprecated issue GVs
Restrict Groups to be Synchronized to Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33300].
  {panel}

Make it possible, to define the default value for a custom field in a field configuration.
Now there is only the possibility to set the default value global.

i'd like to have the option, to define a value in context with the project and issuetype - the field "summary" has many different meanings - for example in bugs or new issues.

so we could use the default value as a kind of "templates" - this would be a powerful feature.
fields.summary: Enable Default Values for CF per FieldConfig

h3. Observation
According to customer:
{quote}
Workflow name is "PR & EA Workflow v7". The URL being generated in the workflow schemes is clearly wrongly encoding:
https://jira.uk.xensource.com/secure/admin/workflows/ViewWorkflowSteps.jspa?atl_token=AXYJ-U5JK-L1J8-MFCP%7Cef4fd318c84759a04696b9c31bb9595a2c736c1e%7Clin&workflowMode=live&workflowName=PR+%26amp%3B+EA+Workflow+v7
As you see Jira is generating "PR+%26amp%3B+EA+Workflow+v7" instead of "PR+%26+EA+Workflow+v7". If I try what I know it should be the proper URL it will work.
This happens because Jira is first doing a XML encode before doing the URL encoding and that's why it will replace the & with & and encodde the final result, which is wrong. 
{quote}

fields.description:
With the new indexation management, appeared since JIRA 5.1, the OSWokflow Auto Transition (_*auto=true*_ in action tag of XML Descriptor) has risk to produce inconsistency in the indexation.

As soon as a Transition is started, the *OSWorkflowManager* disables the indexation for the current thread, and cause that the IndexManager pushes  all issue indexation in a queue.

At the end of transaction, the *OSWorkflowManager* releases the indexation, and the *IndexManager* iterates on this queue (for the current Thread).

The Bug is that this queue is implemented with a *HashSet<Issue>*, and if we implement an Auto Transition, the same issue is added 2 times in the queue, but with 2 different *MutableIssue*. And since the *HashSet* is based on a *HashMap*, the different version of the Issue are systematically indexed in the update order. Result : The indexation can be inconsistent against values stored in database.

The Queue should be based on a *LinkedHashSet* or better, the last version of the issue should be the only indexed.
fields.summary: Usage of native OSWorkflow Auto Transiton has many risk of inconsistency due to the new Index Management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33292].
  {panel}

As discovered in a customer issue:

Subsets of users will see slow performance. Others have everything working just fine. This slowdown happens across all pages within JIRA. The instance has a large number of projects. Users facing slowdown only have access to a small subset of projects. The names of the projects they have access to, are towards the end of the alphabet.

JIRA will complete a permission check when there is a single success. This check is currently performed per project in an alphabetical order. If there is a large number of projects, and the user only has permission to the ones at the end of the alphabet, they will experience slowdown at every permission check (every page).

h3.Workaround
The workaround is to create a bogus project called "A" and add users to the permission scheme here.
fields.summary: Improve performance for checking user permissions with large number of projects

fields.description:
When you are viewing the XML view of a list of issues, the XML tree has a field call link, with the URL to the issue. This link is relative to the URL used in the request. Example: The URL http://192.168.35.133:8181 return: {noformat} Your Company JIRA http://192.168.35.133:8181/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery= An XML representation of a search request en-us 6.0-beta1 6080 15-04-2013 [SDFDSFSD-301] Bishoprics windscreens emulsification teasel's Whitfield's celibacy subsistence's residuals clearing http://192.168.35.133:8181/browse/SDFDSFSD-301 sdfdsfsd

Whiffed Balanchine's Spaniard's systematized glamorously cordon acknowledgment Josephus's Chile's reunify reproachful biweekly rakish Fredrick's improvisation's tailgate's tenor Bulganin's Reaganomics's Fijian's caseload scraper truculence's transitting

 SDFDSFSD-301 Bishoprics windscreens emulsification teasel's Whitfield's celibacy subsistence's residuals clearing ... {noformat} Same JIRA server now using the hostname instead: http://littertray:8181 {noformat} Your Company JIRA http://littertray:8181/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery= An XML representation of a search request en-us 6.0-beta1 6080 15-04-2013 [SDFDSFSD-301] Bishoprics windscreens emulsification teasel's Whitfield's celibacy subsistence's residuals clearing http://littertray:8181/browse/SDFDSFSD-301 sdfdsfsd

Whiffed Balanchine's Spaniard's systematized glamorously cordon acknowledgment Josephus's Chile's reunify reproachful biweekly rakish Fredrick's improvisation's tailgate's tenor Bulganin's Reaganomics's Fijian's caseload scraper truculence's transitting

 SDFDSFSD-301 Bishoprics windscreens emulsification teasel's Whitfield's celibacy subsistence's residuals clearing ... {noformat} The problem with this is that when this XML is a feed to another application (i.e.: a Confluence JIRA Issues macro), the links for the issues will make reference to the address used instead of the server base URL. In this case, it is a common setup to have Confluence and JIRA running in the same private network and they may not be able to contact each other in their public URL, but using a private IP or hostname will lead to broken links for end users. I think all links served by JIRA should use the server base URL instead of the URL used in the request.
fields.summary: Issue links in XML view do not use server base URL but current URL
